TextBlock.Text: HAWTHORN: Nymphaea liberta, unlike most other species of its genus, does not require a stem to affix it to roots or soil. It floats freely on the water's surface. This adaptation allows it to adjust to floods and droughts without concern.
HAWTHORN: How liberating it must be to be untethered, drifting beneath the stars with no great weight affixing you in place.
